DOC.HEAD: Police Defuse Letter Bomb Disguised as Christmas Gift
DOC.TEXT: Police on Monday defused a grenade wrapped as a Christmas gift after the recipient discovered the detonator ring protruding through the wrapping paper, officials said. The package, wrapped in holiday paper, was delivered on Christmas Day to the owner of a small hotel and rooming house in the city's entertainment district, said police Lt. Edilberto Capacete. As the owner was opening the gift, he noticed the grenade detonator ring and called police, Capacete said. The motive for the intended attack was unknown. Col. Ernesto Diokno, acting commander of the Western Police District, said the grenade would probably have killed several people had it exploded.
